attributes.action: Allow pets to travel in the cabin when entering the UK on commercial flights
attributes.additional_details: The current rules are inconsistent and outdated. Pets can enter the UK by car, ferry, or private jet under the same biosecurity rules but are banned from cabin travel on commercial flights. This causes unnecessary stress, higher costs, and welfare risks. Aligning rules would improve animal welfare without reducing safety.
attributes.background: Review and update DEFRA rules to allow pets to enter the UK in the cabin on commercial flights, provided they meet existing pet travel requirements such as microchip, rabies vaccination, and valid pet passport or equivalent documentation.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petition, which calls for similar action:

Change rules to allow pets in airplane cabins going to and from the UK
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/727223
